title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: Oh, Fergus Macleod, I wish the days we used to fish in the Girron Burn, you and Colin and me, could come back, I am so lonely up here by myself.'

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: ' Do you see Craig Hulich over there, Edith ? Do you think it could walk over here and place itself in the Girron Burn?

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: Ellen Macleod had missed the boy from the house, and, watching by the upper front windows, she saw him cross the Girron Burn, and guessed where he had been.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: When he reached the bridge spanning the Girron Burn, he

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: The carriage-way to the mansion of Dalmore branched off the public road, crossed the Girron Burn by a rather unsteady- looking wooden bridge, propped up by divot and peat, led through the marshy low ground at the base of Crom Creagh, and finally wound up the steep slope of the hill to the house.
